1.verse: Introduction -Chapter 1 -Address and Greeting. -Paul, by the will of God an apostle of Christ Jesus, to the saints who are in Ephesus and are faithful in Christ Jesus.

2.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: The Risen Christ, Lord and Savior of the Whole Human Race -God’s Glorious Plan of Salvation -Conceived by the Father -Blessed be the God,and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,who has blessed us in Christwith every spiritual blessing in the heavens.

4.verse: Before the foundation of the worldhe chose us in Christto be holy and blameless in his sightand to be filled with love.

5.verse: He predestined usfor adoption as his childrenthrough Jesus Christ,in accordance with his purpose and pleasure,

6.verse: to the praise of the gloryof his gracethat he so freely bestowed on usin the Beloved.

7.verse: Realized by the Son -In Christand through his bloodwe have redemptionand the forgiveness of our sins.In accord with the riches of his grace,

8.verse: God lavished on usall wisdom and insight.

9.verse: He has made known to usthe mystery of his willin accordance with his good pleasurethat he had predetermined in Christ

10.verse: to be realized whenthe fullness of time had been achieved:namely, the plan to bring all things,both in heaven and on earth,together in Christas the head.

11.verse: Fulfilled by the Holy Spirit -In Christ we were also chosen,having been predestinedby the one who accomplishes all thingsin accordance with the design of his will,

12.verse: so that we,who were the first onesto place our hopes in Christ,would devote ourselvesto the praise of his glory.

13.verse: In Christyou also heard the message of truthand the gospel of your salvation,and you came to believe in him.In him,you were marked with the sealof the Holy Spiritwho had been promised.

14.verse: That Spirit is the down payment of our inheritance,which we shall sharewhen God has redeemed usas his own possession,to the praise of his glory.

15.verse: The Church’s Unity with Christ -Christ, Head of the Church. -Having heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus and of your love toward all the saints,

16.verse: I therefore never cease to give thanks to God for you as I remember you in my prayers.

17.verse: I pray that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you a spirit of wisdom and revelation to know him.

18.verse: I further pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened so that you may know the hope to which he has called you, how rich and glorious is his inheritance in the saints,

19.verse: and how immeasurably great is the power that he has exercised toward those who have faith.Such was his mighty power

20.verse: that he exhibited in Christwhen he raised him from the deadand enthroned himat his right hand in heaven,

21.verse: far aboveevery principality and authority,power and dominion,and every other titlethat can be named,not only in this agebut also in the age to come.

22.verse: He has put all thingsunder Christ’s feetand has made himthe head of the Church,

23.verse: which is his body,the fullness of himwho fills the universein all its parts.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Christ Brought Us from Death to Life. -You formerly were dead as a result of your transgressions and sins,

2.verse: which were your way of life in this worldly era, obeying the ruler of the kingdom of the air, the spirit that is now at work among the children of rebellion.

3.verse: We too were all numbered among them at one time. We were ruled by our sinful nature, succumbing to the temptations of the flesh and desires. And like all others, we were by nature children of wrath.

4.verse: But God is rich in his mercy, and because he had such great love for us,

5.verse: he brought us to life with Christ when we were already dead through sin—it is by grace that you have been saved.

6.verse: He raised us up in union with Christ Jesus and enthroned us with him in the heavens,

7.verse: so that in the ages to come he might show the immeasurable riches of his grace evidenced by his mercy to us in Christ Jesus.

8.verse: For it is by grace that you have been saved through faith. This has not come from you but from the gift of God.

9.verse: It does not come from works, so that no one can boast.

10.verse: For we are God’s handiwork, created in Christ Jesus for a life of good works that God had prepared for us to do.

11.verse: Jews and Gentiles Reconciled in the Church. -Therefore, do not forget that at one time you were Gentiles in the flesh, called the uncircumcised by those who refer to themselves as the circumcised because of a physical rite.

12.verse: Remember that you were at that time separated from Christ, excluded from the community of Israel, and foreigners to the covenants of promise. You were in the world without hope and without God.

13.verse: But now in Christ Jesus, you who once were far off have been brought near through the blood of Christ.

14.verse: For he is our peace,who has made the two into one,by breaking down the barrier of hostility.In his flesh

15.verse: he has abolished the Lawwith its commandments and ordinances,so that he might create in himselfa single new person out of the two,thereby making peace,

16.verse: and that he might reconcile both groupsto God in one bodythrough the cross,thereby putting that enmity to death.

17.verse: Therefore, Jesus cameand proclaimed peaceto you who were far awayand peace to those who were near.

18.verse: For through himwe both have access to the Fatherin the one Spirit.

19.verse: As a result, you are no longer strangers and foreigners. Rather, you are fellow citizens of the saints and members of the household of God,

20.verse: built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, with Christ Jesus himself as the cornerstone.

21.verse: Through him the entire structure is joined together and grows into a holy temple in the Lord.

22.verse: In him you are also being built together into a dwelling place for God in the Spirit.

1.verse: Paul’s Commission To Preach the Mystery -Chapter 3 -The Mystery Made Known. -This is the reason why I, Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus for the sake of you Gentiles—

2.verse: For you surely must have heard of the mystery of God’s grace that was entrusted to me on your behalf,

3.verse: and how the mystery was made known to me by a revelation, as I have briefly written.

4.verse: Reading this, you will be able to perceive my understanding of the mystery of Christ.

5.verse: It was not disclosed to human beings in previous generations, but now it has been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit,

6.verse: namely that the Gentiles have become coheirs, members of the same body, and sharers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel.

7.verse: Mission to the Gentiles. -I became its minister by God’s grace bestowed on me through the working of his power.

8.verse: Although I am the very least of all the saints, this grace was given me: to proclaim to the Gentiles the unfathomable riches of Christ

9.verse: and to enlighten all concerning the administration of the mystery that had been kept hidden throughout the ages in God, the creator of all things.

10.verse: In this way, the wisdom of God in its infinite variety might be made known through the Church to the principalities and powers in the heavens.

11.verse: This was in accordance with the eternal purpose that he has carried out in Christ Jesus our Lord,

12.verse: in whom we have free access to God in boldness and confidence because of our faith in him.

13.verse: Therefore, I beg you not to lose heart over my sufferings for you. Truly, they are your glory.

14.verse: Prayer for a Deeper Faith. -This is the reason why I kneel in prayer before the Father,

15.verse: from whom every family in heaven and on earth takes its name.

16.verse: I ask that from the riches of his glory he may grant through his Spirit that you be strengthened with power in your inner being

17.verse: and that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith.And I pray that, rooted and grounded in love,

18.verse: you may have the power to comprehend with all the saints its breadth and length and height and depth,

19.verse: and know Christ’s love even though it is beyond knowledge, so that you may be filled with all the fullness of God.

20.verse: To him who in all things is ablethrough the powerthat is at work within usto accomplish abundantly far morethan all we can ask or imagine,

21.verse: to him be glory in the Churchand in Christ Jesusthrough all generations,forever and ever. Amen.

1.verse: New Life in the Church -For Christians in General -Chapter 4 -Christian Unity and Maturity. -Therefore, as a prisoner for the Lord, I implore you to behave in a manner worthy of the calling you have received,

2.verse: with all humility, gentleness, and patience, bearing with one another in a spirit of love.

3.verse: Make every possible effort to preserve the unity of the Spirit through the bond of peace.

4.verse: There is one body and one Spirit, as well as one hope to which you have been called by your vocation,

5.verse: one Lord, one faith, one baptism,

6.verse: one God and Father of all, who is over all and through all and in all.

7.verse: But each of us was given grace according to the measure in which Christ allotted it.

8.verse: Therefore, it is written,“When he ascended to the heights,he took prisoners into captivityand gave gifts to men.”

9.verse: Now the word “ascended” implies that he also descended into the lower regions of the earth.

10.verse: The one who descended is also the one who ascended far above all the heavens, so that he might fill all things.

11.verse: It was he who established some as apostles, some as prophets, some as evangelists, and some as pastors and teachers,

12.verse: to equip the saints for the work of ministry in building up the body of Christ,

13.verse: until all of us attain to the unity of faith and the knowledge of the Son of God, to full maturity, as measured by the full stature of Christ.

14.verse: In this way, we will no longer be like children, tossed back and forth by the waves and swept along by every new wind of teaching, emanating from human cunning and craftiness and leading people into error.

15.verse: Rather, professing truth and love, we will in all things grow into him who is the head, Christ.

16.verse: From him, the entire body, joined and held together by every ligament, continues to grow and to build itself up in love, as each part performs its particular function.

17.verse: The Newness of the Christian Life. -Therefore, I declare and attest in the Lord that you must no longer live as the Gentiles do, in the futility of their minds.

18.verse: They are darkened in their understanding and alienated from the life of God because of their ignorance and their hardness of heart.

19.verse: Having lost all sensitivity, they have abandoned themselves to vice, committing every kind of impurity in growing excess.

20.verse: That is not how you learned Christ.

21.verse: Clearly, you were told about him and were taught what the truth is in Jesus.

22.verse: You were taught to cast aside the old self of your former way of life that had been corrupted by its captivating desires.

23.verse: You are to be renewed in the spirit of your minds,

24.verse: and to clothe yourselves with the new self created in God’s image, in the way of uprightness and holiness that belong to the truth.

25.verse: A Life Based on Love. -Therefore, cease your lying and speak the truth to each other, for we are all members of one another.

26.verse: If you are angry, do not sin. Do not let the sun set on your anger,

27.verse: and do not give the devil an opening.

28.verse: Anyone who has been stealing must no longer do so; rather, let him labor, performing some honest work with his own hands, so that he may have something to share with those in need.

29.verse: Let no foul word ever pass your lips. Say only what is useful for edification, so that your words may benefit your listeners.

30.verse: And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God who has marked you with his seal for the day of redemption.

31.verse: Remove all forms of bitterness and wrath and anger and shouting and slander, as well as all malice from your lives.

32.verse: Rather, be kind to one another and compassionate, and forgive one another as God has forgiven you in Christ.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Hence, be imitators of God, as beloved children,

2.verse: and walk in love, as Christ loved us and gave himself up for us as a sacrificial offering whose fragrance is pleasing to God.

3.verse: Sins To Avoid. -Indeed, fornication and impurity of any kind, as well as greed, should not even be mentioned among you. Such talk is not fitting for saints.

4.verse: You should never engage in any obscene or foolish or suggestive conversation. All this is completely out of place. Instead, you should rather be engaged in offering thanks to God.

5.verse: You can be absolutely certain that no immoral or impure person or one who is greedy—that is, an idolater—will have any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

6.verse: Let no one deceive you with worthless arguments. These are the very things that bring down the wrath of God on those who are disobedient.

8.verse: Christians Are Children of Light. -Once you were darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light,

9.verse: for light produces all goodness and righteousness and truth.

10.verse: Discern what the Lord finds pleasing.

11.verse: Take no part in the fruitless deeds of darkness, but rather seek to expose them.

12.verse: For it is shameful even to speak of what deeds people do in secret.

13.verse: However, everything that is exposed by the light is made visible,

14.verse: and whatever is made visible is light. Therefore, it is said,“Awake, O sleeper!Rise from the dead,and Christ will shine on you.”

15.verse: Therefore, take care to live as intelligent people, and do not be like those who are senseless.

16.verse: Make the most of the present time, for this is a wicked age.

17.verse: Do not be foolish, but recognize what is the will of the Lord.

18.verse: Do not get drunk on wine, which can lead to debauchery.Rather, be filled with the Spirit,

19.verse: as you sing psalms and hymns and spiritual songs with one another. Sing and chant to the Lord in your hearts,

20.verse: giving thanks to God the Father at all times and for everything in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

21.verse: Christ and Christian Spouses -Be Subject to One Another in Christ. -Be subject to one another out of reverence for Christ.

22.verse: Wives, be subject to your husbands as you are to the Lord.

23.verse: For the husband is the head of the wife, just as Christ is the head of the Church, the body of which he is the Savior.

24.verse: Just as the Church is subject to Christ, so also wives must be subject to their husbands in everything.

25.verse: Love One Another in Christ. -Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the Church and gave himself up for her

26.verse: in order to sanctify her by cleansing her with water and the word,

27.verse: in order to present the Church to himself in splendor, without spot or wrinkle or any such flaw, but holy and without the slightest blemish.

28.verse: In the same way, husbands should love their wives as they do their own bodies. The man who loves his wife loves himself.

29.verse: For no one ever hates his own body; rather, he nourishes it and cares for it, even as Christ does for the Church,

30.verse: because we are members of his body.

31.verse: For this reasona man shall leave his father and motherand be joined to his wife,and the two shall become one flesh.

32.verse: This is a great mystery. Here I am applying it to Christ and the Church.

33.verse: However, each one of you should love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife should respect her husband.

1.verse: Chapter 6 -Christ and the Members of the Household -Children and Parents. -Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for it is only right that you should do so.

2.verse: “Honor your father and your mother.” This is the first commandment that is connected with a promise:

3.verse: “that it may go well with you and that you may have a long life on earth.”

4.verse: Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.

5.verse: Slaves and Masters. -Slaves, be constant in your unwavering obedience to your earthly masters with fear and trembling and with the same heartfelt sincerity that you show to Christ.

6.verse: Do this not just when they are watching you, as if you only had to please human beings, but as slaves of Christ, wholeheartedly carrying out the will of God.

7.verse: Do your work willingly, as for the Lord and not for human beings,

8.verse: knowing that whatever good we may do, whether as slaves or as free men, we will be repaid by the Lord.

9.verse: And masters, treat your slaves fairly. Stop threatening them. Remember that both of you have the same Master in heaven, and he shows no favoritism.

10.verse: The Christian Warfare -Put On the Armor of God. -Finally, find your strength in the Lord and in his mighty power.

11.verse: Put on the armor of God so that you will be able to stand firm against the deceit of the devil.

12.verse: For we are not struggling against flesh and blood, but against the principalities, the powers, and the cosmic rulers of this present darkness, and against the spirits of evil in the heavens.

13.verse: Therefore, put on the armor of God, so that you will be able to hold fast on the evil day and to hold your ground with all your strength.

14.verse: Stand firm, then, with the belt of truth fastened around your waist, with the breastplate of righteousness clothing you,

15.verse: and with your feet shod in zeal to proclaim the gospel of peace.

16.verse: In all circumstances, hold in your hand the shield of faith with which you will be able to quench all the flaming arrows of the evil one.

17.verse: And take the helmet of salvation as well as the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.

18.verse: Be Vigilant in Prayer. -In all of your prayers and entreaties, pray always in the Spirit. To that end, keep alert and always persevere in supplication for all the saints.

19.verse: Pray also for me, so that whenever I open my mouth, I may be given the proper words to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel,

20.verse: for which I am an ambassador in chains. Pray that I may proclaim it fearlessly, as is my duty.

21.verse: Conclusion -A Personal Message. -So that you may know how I am and what I am doing, Tychicus, my beloved brother and a faithful minister in the Lord, will keep you informed.

22.verse: I am sending him to you for this specific purpose, so that you will know how we are and that your hearts may be encouraged.

23.verse: Final Greeting. -May God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ grant peace and love with faith to all the brethren.

24.verse: Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with undying devotion.
